name: Embassy Suites Sacramento - Riverfront Promenade

reviews.text: I stayed here for four nights in December 2012 for a business trip. The rooms were clean. I felt that the bathroom could have been updated a little but it was very clean too. The breakfast was what I have grown to expect from all Embassy Suites, lots of food options and tasty. The coffee in the room was above average which thrills a coffee drinker like me. I slept well here. I did make it down to the workout room which had what I needed for my exercise routine.
reviews.title: Average Stay for Business Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room clean. Nearby sights worthwhile. Parking overpriced. Breakfast Average. Friendly staff. Good for sleeping. Overall, I would stay here again. I felt safe and enjoyed the waterfront. I do think that paying extra for the "riverfront" was not worth it, but the alternative would have been facing the freeway. Also, there was a bright white light shining in our window, so the curtains stayed close-defeats the "riverfront" price. And since the windows were rather small, "riverfront" view was hard to enjoy.
reviews.title: Clean, close to everything. Old Toen nearby! Waterfront walk, nice. Free Breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed here a year ago; it was expensive then and moreso now. It is a good hotel and the rooms are very nice but the manager's reception (i.e. happy hour) is overrated and the nibbles are very basic. However, the breakfast is first rate. Beware of the wifi charges...Hilton charges a fee per device....that is my biggest and ongoing beef with the Hilton chain, they are stuck in this outmoded era of charging for wifi and at this location the charge is compounded by the fact the charge is per device. Lesser hotel chains offer free wifi.
reviews.title: expensive and wifi charges are ridiculous

reviews.text: Very average hotel... First off, from the very first connection point - parking - we were astounded at how ridiculous their system was. The 'self-parking' option is across the street in a paid public structure! So, pretty much forced to valet at $25 per day (and consequently not have any easy access to our car and stuff).
reviews.title: Only good aspect is the location

reviews.text: As far as the room, like most Embassy Suites it was quite spacious... So I suppose that would be the one other positive 'aspect'. :-). However, the fold-out sofa bed was broken, I had to jury-rig it to enable the kids to sleep on it.
reviews.title: Another Mistake when checking in, Even with a free certificate.

reviews.text: A quick business trip took me to Sacramento. I made an online reservation for the Embassy Suites on the Riverfront. Very easy and quick, but a room with a King Size bed was not available. I used the comment section to ask for a King Size bed. Upon arrival, Maria called up my reservation, noted my request and proceeded to find me a room with King size bed :-)
reviews.title: Don't be afraid to ask...

reviews.text: I then asked about the location for my business meeting... it was only 7/10's of a mile away, but my wife was attending with me and she did not feel like walking the distance in high heels. I asked about a cab and Maria suggested I talk with the Valet about the hotel's shuttle van. I quickly arranged for the shuttle van to take us to the meeting. Our driver, Jose, gave me his card and told me to call him when the meeting was over and he would come back to pick us up!
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: What fabulous service! To go along with a wonderful, made to order free breakfast, and another shuttle trip to the airport, I would highly recommend the Embassy Suites Riverfront in Sacramento! Thanks for great trip.
reviews.title: Quick Trip Great Night's Sleep
Comfortable hotel, best location in Sacramento
reviews.text: We really benefitted from the location of this hotel. It is only a few blocks from the capital making it close enough to walk for a tour of the capital. And, it is right across the street from Old Town and all that there is to see there. We loved the shops, 1900 School House, and Pony Express Monument--where it all started.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have a pretty good breakfast with omlettes to order (egg whites are an option) and many other breakfast foods (hot and cold). The lunches are okay but pricey, as most hotels are.
reviews.title: Sac. CA Embassy Suites is a lovely clean hotel...great bang for your buck!

reviews.text: This hotel is within steps to the state capital. Happy hour that included free drinks and appetizers from 5:30 to 7:30. As it seems for all Embassy's, the room are large and clean. The front desk was helpful with everything and then some. The gym is nice with cardio and free weights. I will stay here again when I come to Sacramento.
reviews.title: Great location and service

reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise! We really enjoyed a 2-night stay with the kids at this well-known hotel. Service was strong all around, from valet to bar-person serving drinks on a Friday night at the free drinks free-for-all known as the Manager's Reception. Breakfast selections were standard fare, but fresh and well-prepared. We have all experienced hotel breakfast buffets that might have declined were they not included. The breakfasts at Sac Embassy were very good, another pleasant surprise. Rooms were clean and well-maintained. The riverfront promenade in front of the hotel has been nicely cleaned up since I was here several years ago. Overall, for the hotel class, an excellent stay, and very good value ($139 for 2 room double). Superior location as well, though a bit noisy as it is directly above the freeway.
reviews.title: 4+ out of 5!

reviews.text: The hotel is location next to the Tower Bridge, an ideal location to visit Old Sacramento. Valet parking service is quick in and out. The front desk were welcoming and attentive. My room was a typical room for Embassy chain. It was roomy, clean and comfortable. The only issue I had was with the WiFi having spotty service. Breakfast was included and the omelettes made to order were good. Overall a good experience.
reviews.title: Good Experience

reviews.text: Good...
reviews.title: The Good, the Bad and the UGLY :)

reviews.text: -I pulled in the wrong way in the parking lot and the well-dressed gentleman who worked at Embassy who saw me do it was very kind and helped me get situated. :)
reviews.title: Service lacking and lost item

reviews.text: Booked last minutes with the hotel directly and had great experience. Kind staff called me by name and enjoyed the hotel aminities. Nice breakfast and reception spread and our room had a river view which was sure a plus. Looked down at old historic bridge. No self parking.. so Parking was added expense but was in the city so understood. Will return.
reviews.title: Good Experience nice river views

reviews.text: Our choice was be stuck in Reno 3 days, after a great Lake Tahoe ski vacay OR drive to Sacramento and leave the next day. We chose Sacramento and could not be happier. As a HIlton Honors member, I got this reservation, day of travel, with my honors points! Location was GREAT! We were not expecting to be 1 block away from old town Sacramento - activities for kids and adults. The kids LOVED the train station, candy and toy stores that were around the corner. We had a room overlooking the tower bridge and my son STILL talks about the bridge.
reviews.title: Unexpected delay = nice surprise!
Great location on the river
reviews.text: As for the room - Embassy suite can't be beat for a family. Two separate rooms, everything you need, not to mention manager's social and great hot breakfast. The staff was welcoming and prompt to deliver our forgotten toothpaste!
Parking - cost us, but the room did not so no worries there - I think it was $25 for valet.
reviews.title: Central and bit Funky

reviews.text: View - WONDERFUL
reviews.title: Nice for Business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I notice that there were a few negative reviews mixed in with the generally good ones, so I was a little nervous about staying here. But it turned out to be a great place. We were in town for my company's holiday party, so planned to stay overnight rather than try to drive back to the Bay Area. One or more of the negative comments mentioned excessive noise. You could see how that might be an issue, with the open interior - when we arrived, they were setting up for several office parties. However, this did not end up being a problem. We returned to the hotel from our party at around 11, and all of the ones at the hotel were done by then, more or less. Also, the sleeping area of the suites are at the far end of the room from the open interior. Our room was totally quiet all night.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay - Great Room

likes.disliked: — Get a room on the river side - great views

reviews.text: The room itself was great - everything seemed brand new and worked fine. It was nice having such a large room - I enjoyed sitting in the "living room" area in the morning with a cup of coffee and the complimentary newspaper.
reviews.title: Great for families, not for a relaxing getaway

reviews.text: I was with my wife only, but if our son had been along, he could have slept on the sofabed in the living room area - it's nice to have a suite with the option of closing off the separate rooms.
reviews.title: great location
Great for families
reviews.text: Staff was very nice. (Included) Breakfast was excellent.

reviews.title: We liked it!
reviews.text: One final thing. It was a rainy weekend, and we accidentally left our umbrella in the car after sending it off with the valet parking crew. But the hotel came through with a loaner at no charge!

reviews.title: Best Embassy Suites I've Ever Stayed At!!
reviews.text: I stayed two nights at the Embassy Suites Sacramento to check out the local college. My original intention was to use the self parking though because I could not find the lot I just used valet (even after tip valet is cheaper, however I don’t think you get in and out privileges). The bell and valet staffs seemed eager to help and were very informed when it came to directions and such.

reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful
reviews.text: The front desk was literally right in front of the entrance (just a couple steps). This was a poor design on their part because you always walked into a large crowed of people and a mess of luggage when walking to your room. As a gold member, per request, I was upgraded to a top floor river view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very new looking and was very nicely decorated. Marble counter tops, two closets, free internet, and a ceiling fan were just a few of the amenities I don’t see in every Embassy Suites.
reviews.title: Embassy Suites Located Across from Old Sacramento

likes.disliked: — Having to pay $18.00 a day for parking

reviews.text: The manager’s reception was standard affair. The bartenders were all very personable and were eager to have you try their custom mix drinks (Give them a try, their not bad). The breakfast was also standard affair. Cook to order omelets and everything else is buffet style.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, horrible staff

reviews.text: The location was wonderful. Old Town was just across the street and when you walk to the front of the building you see out state’s capital on one side and the historic Tower Bridge on the other. On a side note, I highly recommend going to Joe’s Crab Shack just across the street on the water. The food was great, the prices were reasonable and it was just a fun place to eat. However the wait can be more than an hour (what we did was put our name down, went back to the hotel and had our free drinks at the manager’s reception and came back).
reviews.title: Quiet, Comfortable, Great Service

reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise. We added a stop in Sacramento last minute and needed accommodation for the family - three kids. After a long drive we arrive and they could not have been friendly - we arrive at 1:00 pm (check in isn't until 4 pm) but they had everything ready. The room was very large and clean and they even brought up a roll-away bed at no cost (most hotels charge $10-$15/night). Not only that but when we called to ask for one - they had it delivered in 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Great Staff

reviews.text: The location was great - we walked down the riverfront to Old Town and the train museum. Returned back in time for the mangers cocktails - they actually were serving wine, beer and mixed drinks. Again, the staff was very friendly, joking with everyone in line.
reviews.title: Ok Hotel.
Great hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast was good - nothing fancy, but for a free meal it was better then most hotels. They had made to order omelettes and a very nice fresh fruit buffet.
The pool was okay - small and inside - but it worked for the kids who had been sitting in the car all morning.
reviews.title: Not Too Shabby

reviews.text: We would definitely return here and recommend it to friends.
reviews.title: Lousy Wi-Fi

reviews.text: Nothing worked in room - refrigerator, phone, safe all broken. They didn't even have a room for me for several hours, despite having my reservation. Carpets and sheets are threadbare. Bathtub was clogged. Breakfast was awful. Pool and fitness rooms are jokes.
reviews.title: Seedy, going downhill fast

aka: Embassy Suites Sacramento - Riverfront Promenade Hotel
description: The Newly Renovated Embassy Suites Sacramento - Riverfront Promenade hotel is located on the Sacramento River across from historic Old Town Sacramento. This full-service upscale all-suite hotel is just minutes from the California State Capitol, ARCO Arena, Sacramento International Airport and the Cal Expo - California Exposition and State Fair. Guests of the Embassy Suites Sacramento hotel stay in spacious two-room suites and will enjoy many hotel amenities, services, and facilities in addition to our Complimentary Cooked-to-Order Breakfast and Complimentary Nightly Manager's Reception.
